before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bijq5","text":"In order to protect the individuals from the potential HepB virus infection while working with human blood, the U.S.A. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issued a recommendation for HepB vaccination to be carried out in individuals before they start working with human blood. Vaccine-induced antibody titer to the HepB virus of ≥10 mIU/mL should be present in individuals before commencing work with human blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":83}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C9AE6BE043E011ED9F6DC515692A38AB","url":"https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/rr6210a1.htm"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6b68g","text":"Vitamin K antagonists (e.g. warfarin) are anticoagulants which represent widely prescribed drugs for prevention and treatment of thromboembolic disorders. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bic7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eptrb","text":"Warfarin's molecular target is vitamin K epoxide reductase enzyme and its metabolism is performed by the cytochrome P-450 2C9 enzyme, both of which are encoded by polymorphic genes - vitamin K epoxide reductase complex subunit 1 (VKORC1) and cytochrome P-450 2C9 (CYP2C9), respectively. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":230,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":264,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqvk5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"33d16","text":"Identification of the VKORC1 and CYP2C9 genotypes was recommended by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration in 2007, in order to guide the initial dosing of warfarin, the first oral vitamin K antagonist drug, to achieve the optimum anticoagulation and prevent hemorrhagic events. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8nod","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7oerf","text":"In an effort to provide a lab protocol that will provide training in pharmacogenomics/pharmacogenetics (PGx) for undergraduate students of pharmacology or medicine, that can be performed in a laboratory that contains basic molecular biology equipment and by using reagents that are available worldwide at low cost, we revisited protocols published previously by other researchers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"l4pm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ks6t","text":"We hope that it will provide the elementary understanding of the simplest molecular biology methods used to identify different VKORC1 (-1639G\u003eA) and CYP2C9 genotypes, as well as understanding of a link between a specific genotype (or combination of genotypes) and phenotype relevant for a patient’s drug response.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":127,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":135,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":149,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3i7v0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cpd34","text":"The protocol represents a step-by-step guide to using polymerase chain reaction restriction fragment length polymorphism (PCR-RFLP) method in determining VKORC1 -1639G\u003eA, CYP2C9*1/*1, CYP2C9*1/*2, CYP2C9*1/*3, and CYP2C9*2/*3 genotypes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":154,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":171,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":184,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":197,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":214,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4dvgq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cb1","text":"Based on the combination of the VKORC1 -1639G\u003eA and CYP2C9 genotypes, that is, the pattern of DNA fragments observed at the end of an experiment, which are visualized using agarose gel electrophoresis and DNA staining, a conclusion on an individual’s sensitivity to warfarin and appropriate drug dose is reached. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":52,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v042","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cek4o","text":"A dataset containing the VKORC1 -1639G\u003eA and CYP2C9 genotypes characterized in 32 patients using this protocol was deposited at the Harvard Dataverse Repository that can be accessed at the following digital object identifier: https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/SFPYCD. In the dataset, the patients were grouped into the following anticoagulant sensitivity/dosing categories, as recommended by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) label for warfarin: 1) standard anticoagulant sensitivity/dosing genotypes (N=20), 2) intermediate anticoagulant sensitivity/dosing genotypes (N=11), and 3) low anticoagulant sensitivity/dosing genotypes (N=1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":226,"length":34}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"46B79A79C23F11EDA31C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/SFPYCD"}}}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvdji","text":"DISCLAIMER – FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY; USE AT YOUR OWN RISK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1pieu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fm2sa","text":"The protocol content here is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

funders.funder_name: Ministry of Science, Higher Education and Youth of Canton Sarajevo, Sarajevo, Bosnia & Herzegovina

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"77cjv","text":"This protocol uses human whole blood as a starting material for extracting human, genomic DNA. Human whole blood could be a source of hepatitis B (HepB) virus infection (if taken from persons with HepB virus infection) to the individuals who work with human blood and, as such, represents health and safety or biological hazard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
image_attribution: Mirsada Causevic, Honours BSc, PhD, Sarajevo Medical School, Sarajevo School of Science and Technology, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina
keywords: Vitamin K Epoxide Reductase, Vitamin KO Reductase, VKORC1, Cytochrome P-450, CYP2C9

BenchTop 100bp DNA Ladder - Promega G8291;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e6ukd","text":"DNA ladder (2) - MiniSizer 50bp DNA Ladder - Norgen 11200;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ec7k9","text":"dNTPs - dATP, dCTP, dGTP and dTTP - at a stock concentration of 100mM each - Promega U1330;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"29hjf","text":"EDTA - Sigma EDS-500G;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7is5i","text":"Ethanol - Sigma 32205-1L;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d3io1","text":"Glycerol - Sigma G5516-500ml;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c0kki","text":"HCl - Sigma 30721-2.5L;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bb2s3","text":"Isopropanol - 2-propanol - Sigma 59304-500ml;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"vsp0","text":"KpnI restriction endonuclease enzyme - Promega R6341;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64sb9","text":"NaCl - Honeywell-Fluka 31434-1KG;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cmfh9","text":"NsiI restriction endonuclease enzyme - New England BioLabs R0127S;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"frtia","text":"MspI restriction endonuclease enzyme - New England BioLabs R0106S;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"24oam","text":"Proteinase K - Sigma P2308;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5e0np","text":"SDS - Sigma L3771-100G;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ccdi9","text":"GoTaq G2 DNA Polymerase - Promega M7845;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b6dcg","text":"Trizma base - Sigma RDD008-1KG.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"243m3","text":"Patients' whole blood was collected in ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA)-containing tubes and stored at -20°C until use. Genomic DNA extraction from the human whole blood, that is, leukocytes, was carried out according to the protocol described by Subbarayan PR and colleagues (doi: 10.2144/02336bm10), with modifications. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":253,"length":28}],"data":[]},{"key":"5spbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"csj0t","text":"Upon thawing of the blood, for every patient's blood sample, five (5) sterile tubes were labeled and 300 μl of the whole blood was added. This was the amount of the starting material that yielded ample amount of human, genomic DNA at the end of the DNA extraction protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"646930E0433011EDA7CB1FC8EBC6CEDE","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12503305/"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkdtv","text":"Concentrations of human, genomic DNA was determined by using Qubit 4 Fluorometer (Q33226, Invitrogen and Thermo Fisher Scientific). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gisg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49ofu","text":"Subsequently, for polymerase chain reactions (PCRs), 100 ng of genomic DNA was used in every PCR reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eju78","text":"Identification of the VKORC1 -1639G\u003eA genotypes was performed according to the polymerase chain reaction-restriction fragment length polymorphism (PCR-RFLP) method-based protocol published by Sconce EA and colleagues (doi: 10.1182/blood-2005-03-1108).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":192,"length":24}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9F6D8F6043C111ED9F6DC515692A38AB","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15947090/"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fe265","text":"PCR reactions were assembled as follows: reactions of 25 μl contained 1) sterile, milliQ-H2O; 2) 1xPCR buffer (for GoTaq G2 DNA polymerase, Promega), from a stock of 5xPCR buffer; 3) 0.2 mM deoxyribonucleotide triphosphates (dNTPs) (U1330, Promega), from a stock of 2.5 mM; 4) 1 μM forward primer, from a stock of 25 μM; 5) 1 μM reverse primer, from a stock of 25 μM; 6) 100 ng of genomic DNA and 7) 2.5 U GoTaq DNA polymerase (M7845, Promega). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":90,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3erbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bve9g","text":"Sequences of the PCR primers were as follows: 1) Forward primer: 5'-GCCAGCAGGAGAGGGAAATA-3'; 2) Reverse primer: 5'-AGTTTGGACTACAGGTGCCT-3'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anud7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9la4n","text":"PCR cycles used for the amplification of the VKORC1 gene promoter, which were based on the touchdown PCR protocol published by Korbie and Mattick in 2008, were as follows: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":127,"length":26}],"data":{}},{"key":"n77m","text":"1) 95°C for 3 min (1 cycle); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26qur","text":"2) 95°C for 2 s, 60°C for 2 s, 72°C for 30 s (2 cycles); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qih0","text":"3) 95°C for 2 s, 59°C for 2 s, 72°C for 30 s (2 cycles); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iobv","text":"4) 95°C for 2 s, 58°C for 2 s, 72°C for 30 s (2 cycles); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uetl","text":"5) 95°C for 2 s, 57°C for 2 s, 72°C for 30 s (2 cycles); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7meer","text":"6) 95°C for 2 s, 56°C for 2 s, 72°C for 30 s (2 cycles); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e9l9","text":"7) 95°C for 2 s, 55°C for 2 s, 72°C for 30 s (30 cycles); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ulrr","text":"8) 72°C for 7 min (1 cycle); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"722tp","text":"9) 4°C for 2 h (1 cycle). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jcid","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t7e5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uv2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"873EBC4043C411ED9F6DC515692A38AB","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18772872/"}},"1":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bk6qq","text":"The expected size of the PCR product is approximately 290 bp.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"618ht","text":"In order to characterise the VKORC1 -1639G\u003eA genotypes by using the PCR-RFLP method, the following reactions were set up with MspI restriction endonuclease enzyme: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":29,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dj4je","text":"1) 25 μl of the PCR product; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1li","text":"2) 3 μl of the 10xCutSmart Buffer (B7204S, New England Biolabs); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"77dva","text":"3) 1 μl of sterile, milliQ-H2O; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f565l","text":"4) 1 μl of MspI enzyme (R0106S, New England Biolabs). Total reaction volume: 30 μl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8vved","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f4d4t","text":"Reactions were incubated in a 37°C water bath overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"do37t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fgr2l","text":"DNA fragments were examined by using 2% agarose gel electrophoresis with 1xTris, boric acid, EDTA (TBE) buffer and agarose gels containing 0.5 mg/ml ethidium bromide (E1510-10ML, Sigma). The results were viewed with a UV lamp (UVstar, Biometra, Analytik Jena). Gel images were captured by using BioDocAnalyze (BDA) camera (Biometra, Analytik Jena).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"biojg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4m62m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2jgl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4c626","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a7mno","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c4i2o","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9n66f","text":"The following pattern of DNA fragments can be expected after the MspI restriction endonuclease enzyme reaction (Figure 1):","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dbgbv","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":9,"style":"italic"}],"key":"6kq13","text":"1) GG or VKORC1 -1639GG genotype is characterized by two (2) DNA fragments of 168 and 122 base pairs (bp);","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a7b8g","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":9,"style":"italic"}],"key":"2lt0h","text":"2) AG or VKORC1 -1639AG genotype is characterized by three (3) DNA fragments of 290, 168 and 122 bp;","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1e9k3","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":10,"style":"italic"}],"key":"29n76","text":"3) AA or VKORC1 -1639AA genotype is characterized by one (1) DNA fragment of 290 bp.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aqr0l","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aa2mo","text":"Identification of the CYP2C9 genotypes (*1/*1, *1/*2, *1/*3, and *2/*3) was performed according to the PCR-RFLP method-based protocol published by Sullivan-Klose TH and colleagues (doi: 10.1097/00008571-199608000-00007) and Yasar U and colleagues (doi: 10.1006/bbrc.1998.9992).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":40,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":47,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":54,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":65,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":147,"length":32},{"key":1,"offset":224,"length":22}],"data":[]},{"key":"f7rvf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"pco6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B275905043C911ED9F6DC515692A38AB","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/8873220/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E238205043C911ED9F6DC515692A38AB","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/9920790/"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj79s","text":"PCR reactions were assembled as follows: reactions of 25 μl contained 1) sterile, milliQ-H2O; 2) 1xPCR buffer (for GoTaq G2 DNA polymerase, Promega), from a stock of 5xPCR buffer; 3) 0.2 mM deoxyribonucleotide triphosphates (dNTPs) (U1330, Promega), from a stock of 2.5 mM; 4) 1 μM forward primer, from a stock of 25 μM; 5) 1 μM reverse primer, from a stock of 25 μM; 6) 100 ng of genomic DNA and 7) 2.5 U GoTaq DNA polymerase (M7845, Promega). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":90,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f4l8u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9iusk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3535n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvuag","text":"Sequences of the PCR primers for AvaII restriction endonuclease enzyme reactions were as follows: 1) AvaII-Forward primer: 5'-TACAAATACAATGAAAATATCATG-3'; 2) AvaII-Reverse primer: 5'-CTAACAACCAGACTCATAATG-3'. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"16tah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"537af","text":"PCR cycles used with the above primers were as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9qf09","text":"1) 94°C for 5 min (1 cycle);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6g2sp","text":"2) 94°C for 60 s; 55°C for 90 s; 72°C for 30 s (35 cycles);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1pvhp","text":"3) 72°C for 7 min;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"88qml","text":"4) 4°C for 2 h (1 cycle).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"27nlb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cu9di","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9hrvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4304r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"jj43","text":"The expected size of the PCR product is 691 bp.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47aud","text":"In order to characterise the CYP2C9 *1/*1 or *1/*2 genotypes by using the PCR-RFLP method, the following reactions were set up with AvaII restriction endonuclease enzyme: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":29,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69dls","text":"1) 10 μl of the PCR product; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blcnd","text":"2) 2 μl of the 10xCutSmart Buffer (B7204S, New England Biolabs); ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iq9p","text":"3) 7 μl of sterile, milliQ-H2O; ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1kms","text":"4) 1 μl of AvaII enzyme (R0153S, New England BioLabs). Total reaction volume: 20 μl.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c377","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"366dh","text":"Reactions were incubated in a 37°C water bath overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4io9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjlva","text":"DNA fragments were examined by using 2% agarose gel electrophoresis with 1xTBE buffer and agarose gels containing 0.5 mg/ml ethidium bromide (E1510-10ML, Sigma). The results were viewed with a UV lamp (UVstar, Biometra, Analytik Jena). Gel images were captured by using BioDocAnalyze (BDA) camera (Biometra, Analytik Jena).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76v3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cc7t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fvu1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8hghn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"478vc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aq3tv","text":"The following pattern of DNA fragments can be expected after the AvaII restriction endonuclease enzyme reaction:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d3645","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":3,"style":"italic"},{"length":13,"offset":12,"style":"italic"}],"key":"9ued7","text":"1) *1/*1 or CYP2C9 *1/*1 genotype is characterized by two (2) DNA fragments of 527 and 164 base pairs (bp) (Figure 2). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":17,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":31,"style":"italic"}],"key":"4tqrb","text":"In addition, the *1/*1 genotype is characterized by one (1) DNA fragment, running between 100 and 200 bp markers when compared to a DNA ladder, which is the result of the NsiI restriction endonuclease enzyme reaction (see sub-steps 7.3 and 7.4) (Figure 2). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":17,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":31,"style":"italic"}],"key":"c6pbj","text":"Furthermore, the *1/*1 genotype is characterized by one (1) DNA fragment, running between 100 and 200 bp markers when compared to a DNA ladder, which is the result of the KpnI restriction endonuclease enzyme reaction (see sub-steps 7.5 and 7.6) (Figure 2).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2prab","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":3,"style":"italic"},{"length":13,"offset":12,"style":"italic"}],"key":"75o43","text":"2) *1/*2 or CYP2C9 *1/*2 genotype is characterized by three (3) DNA fragments of 691, 527 and 164 bp (Figure 3). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":17,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":31,"style":"italic"}],"key":"5vm0g","text":"In addition, the *1/*2 genotype is characterized by one (1) DNA fragment, running between 100 and 200 bp markers when compared to a DNA ladder, which is the result of the NsiI restriction endonuclease enzyme reaction (see sub-steps 7.3 and 7.4) (Figure 3). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":17,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":31,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fdtlr","text":"Furthermore, the *1/*2 genotype is characterized by one (1) DNA fragment, running between 100 and 200 bp markers when compared to a DNA ladder, which is the result of the KpnI restriction endonuclease enzyme reaction (see sub-steps 7.5 and 7.6) (Figure 3).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"f9qtv","text":"Ethidium bromide, which is used during the preparation of agarose gels, is a DNA intercalating dye and it can, therefore, act as a mutagen. It should be handled with care and only when wearing gloves and safety glasses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
